text: that's not a new SimCity gamer looking at its cities skylines from developer colossal order and while its derivative it pulls off when its inspiration couldn't creating huge detailed cities that take on a convincing life of their own with powerful building tools and extensive mod support feeding into an all-around impressive simulation this is the best city builder to come along in a decade building has to be its own reward though because the lack of random events or disasters leaves the job of running these towns feeling sleepy and meditative building a city from scratch is mostly conventional lay down roads with the easy-to-use tools designate zones provide utility services reap the tax boon then repeat the cycle with new stuff that's been unlocked by hitting population milestones skylines gets all these fundamentals pretty much right though it does err on the side of unnecessary complexity through busy work like laying water pipes while you begin building on a small map soon you can
